page.title: 18DAIRY FARMING,PEMBROKE.
page.content: There are many farms to the south of{ {Pembroke}which specialise in dairy farming. Milk production,or dairy farming as it is more usually called,is an important branch of farming in{Great {Britain,}accounting for about a quarter of the total farm sales. { Two-thirds}of the milk produced is sold as fresh milk and the remainder is made into cheese,butter,condensed milk,cream or milk powder. There are more than{three million } dairy cows in Britain.The milk yield from a dairy cow can vary from{1,800 {to 9,000 litres,}but the British average is about{3,500 litres. {
